intro: Reyesia chilensis, commonly known as the Chilean reyesia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of Chile. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of hair. Reyesia chilensis is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in cool, moist conditions.
